title: Cave house may have been home to an English king
description: Archaeologists in England have identified a near-complete Anglo-Saxon cave house, which, they say, may once have been the home of a king who became a saint.

title: CNN rolls the tape on Fox News hosts' anti-vaccine rhetoric
description: CNN's John Berman and Brianna Keilar show some of the anti-vaccine propaganda viewers of right-wing media are being exposed to.

title: Journalist says Iran plotted to kidnap her in the US
description: Iranian journalist and activist Masih Alinejad says that she is the person who is targeted by four Iranian nationals that have been charged in an alleged kidnapping plot. A spokesman for Iran's Foreign Minister called the allegation "baseless."

title: Man went to the wrong apartment to do cleaning. See what happened
description: Louis Angelino went to clean his friend's apartment for extra money. After two hours of hard work, and playing with two cats, he realized he was not in his friend's apartment.

title: White House prepares to fight back in the Covid vaccine disinformation war
By the time this doctor's patients want the vaccine, it's too late
description: By the time Christopher Morrison's patients want the vaccine, it's too late.

title: Olivia Rodrigo visits White House to encourage her 28M social media followers to get vaccinated
description: Pop sensation Olivia Rodrigo visited the White House on Wednesday to meet with President Joe Biden and his chief Covid-19 medical adviser, Dr. Anthony Fauci, to record videos to encourage young people to get vaccinated against the novel coronavirus.

title: People in the Biden administration describe the efforts to fight the spread of dangerous vaccine falsehoods
description: White House officials are devising ways to fight the spread of dangerous falsehoods about Covid-19 vaccines, administration officials told CNN, as Republicans and their media allies ramp up their vocal skepticism about vaccines.

title: Statue of Liberty's 'little sister' takes up residence in Washington DC
description: One hundred and thirty-five years after the Statue of Liberty was formally unveiled in New York Harbor, her "little sister" has taken up residence in front of the French ambassador's home in Washington, DC.

title: 4 Iranian nationals charged with alleged kidnapping plot of US journalist, court documents say
description: Four Iranian nationals have been charged in an alleged plot to kidnap a US journalist and human rights activist from New York, court documents show.

title: The leader of the Republican Party not named Donald Trump
description: Everyone knows that Donald Trump is the king of the Republican Party. What's interesting, however, is that over the last year or so, an heir to that throne has emerged quite clearly. And his name is Ron DeSantis.

title: Cuban YouTuber says she is being taken away by state security during live interview
description: Cuban YouTuber Dina Fernandez, known as Dina Stars, said she was being taken away by Cuban state security forces in Havana during a live interview on Tuesday.

title: Experts are bracing for a spike in STDs, but not just because it's 'hot vax summer'
description: After more than a year of Americans being urged to practice the safe six (feet), infectious disease specialists want to remind them about safe sex.

title: EU unveils ambitious plans to wean off fossil fuels. Can it really deliver?
CEOs made 299 times more than their average workers last year
description: The difference between CEO and median employee pay grew in 2020 despite the Covid pandemic and ongoing relief efforts.

title: There could be a digital euro by the middle of the decade
description: The European Central Bank is moving ahead with efforts to create a digital version of the euro as the use of cash declines and China ramps up tests of its own e-yuan.

title: George W. Bush says consequences of US withdrawal from Afghanistan will be 'unbelievably bad'
description: Former President George W. Bush on Wednesday called the US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan a mistake and predicted that the consequences, especially for Afghan women and girls, will be "unbelievably bad."

title: Nicolas Cage says he won't be in 'Tiger King' series after all
description: Nicolas Cage is now saying he's out of a planned "Tiger King" series.

title: Britney's battle is an enduring consequence of the cruelest celebrity gossip era
description: It is human nature to gossip, to peer behind the gossamer curtain of secrecy separating the rich and famous from the common and curious. In the early 2000s, that age-old impulse reached a toxic nadir. There, in the corners of an internet that still felt novel and lawless, a new breed of bloggers redefined celebrity gossip and set in motion a ruthless media machine that chewed up and spat out any fresh-faced, high-heeled celebrity in its path.

title: Gillian Anderson says she won't wear a bra ever again
description: Gillian Anderson says she is "not wearing a bra anymore," telling fans: "I don't care if my breasts reach my belly button."

title: Parents reunited with abducted son after searching for 24 years
description: The abduction of 2-year-old Guo Xinzhen in eastern China in 1997 sparked a desperate, seemingly never-ending nationwide search by his parents that inspired filmmakers to bring their story to the big screen.

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro admitted to the hospital for abdominal pain and hiccups
description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has been admitted to the hospital to investigate the cause of persistent hiccups that are leading to abdominal pains, according to Brazil's Special Secretariat for Social Communication.

title: Extreme heat will soon kill nearly all young salmon in the Sacramento River, officials say
description: California officials anticipate nearly all juvenile chinook salmon in the Sacramento River will die due to abnormally hot underwater conditions as heat waves continue to bake the West.

title: Drug overdose deaths in 2020 hit highest number ever recorded, CDC data shows
description: Drug overdose deaths rose by close to 30% in the United States in 2020, hitting the highest number ever recorded, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported Wednesday.

title: Biden looks to avoid immigration headache with complicated decision on opening borders
description: The Biden administration faces the possibility of another immigration headache, as it weighs whether to more widely reopen US borders in the near future -- just days from the current travel restrictions expiring.

title: Jason Sudeikis isn't sure what happened with the Olivia Wilde breakup
description: Jason Sudeikis says he's still trying to sort out his split with Olivia Wilde.

title: Lone Republican on Jan. 6 panel so far vows to 'stand for the truth'
Bonfire tradition continues in Northern Ireland amid post-Brexit tensions
description: CNN's Nic Robertson reports from Belfast, Northern Ireland, where citizens celebrate a centuries-old tradition as post-Brexit tensions loom.

title: What hospitals look like in US Covid hot spots
description: Dr. Sergio Segarra says when Covid-19 patient numbers in the Miami hospital he works in dipped below 20 last month, he began feeling optimistic.

title: Which billionaire is winning the space race? It depends
description: Jeff Bezos, Elon Musk and Richard Branson have a combined net worth of $400 billion, roughly the size of the GDP of the entire nation of Ireland. And all three men have decided to put vast sums of their wealth into chasing their space travel dreams, creating a modern space race in which ultra-rich men — rather than countries — shoot for the stars.

title: The secrets of France's most addictive food
description: Baker Christian Vabret is squeezing down gently on a baguette in order to make it "sing."

title: Space tourism won't be affordable for the masses any time soon
description: Billionaires Richard Branson and Jeff Bezos are ready start offering trips to outer space. But only other billionaires — or perhaps millionaires — need apply.

title: Venice bans cruise ships from the city center -- again
description: First there was a ban. Then it became a pre-ban for an uncertain date in the future. Then they were back in the city until further notice.

title: Violence is sweeping around the globe as discontent rises
description: From Cuba to Colombia, South Africa to Lebanon, tensions are igniting across the globe as angry citizens take to the streets over grievances, in part stemming from the governments' response to Covid-19. CNN's Nic Robertson reports.

title: Vaping debate 'heating up' once again
description: It was a pivotal public health crisis in America before the Covid-19 pandemic -- and then we stopped talking about it.

title: 7 modern tree houses to spark your childhood imagination
description: Elevated high above the ground, tree houses are familiar symbols of childhood magic and adventure.

title: Taliban denies executing commandos who surrendered following CNN report
description: The Taliban has denied executing unarmed commandos on June 16 in the town of Dawlat Abad, following a CNN report with video evidence and eyewitness testimony. CNN's Anna Coren reports from Kabul, Afghanistan.

title: Amazon is helping a Chinese upstart make a comeback in India after its app was banned
description: Shein, a fast fashion website that has emerged as a fierce competitor to Zara, is making its return to India — indirectly, at least — after being swept up in a crackdown on Chinese tech companies last year.

title: Chinese workers killed in bus explosion in northern Pakistan
description: At least 10 people have died after a bus carrying Chinese engineers in northern Pakistan fell into a ditch following a "fiery explosion," according to local police.

title: Charles Leclerc on why he is so protective of his brother
description: Split-second decision making, relentless focus and courage are just some of the attributes any Formula One driver needs.

title: California will compensate survivors of its forced sterilization program
description: California will pay $7.5 million to surviving victims of its forced sterilization program.

title: What the American accused of plotting to kill Haiti's President told police
description: Could the traveling pastor with a history of humanitarian work also have masterminded an intricate murder plot to seize power in Haiti?

title: China could soon have an unlikely supporter in Central Asia
description: Editor's note: CNN has launched the Meanwhile in China newsletter, a three-times-a-week update exploring what you need to know about the country's rise and how it impacts the world. Sign up here.

title: Colbert sits down with Richard Branson after trip to space
description: Richard Branson appeared on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert to talk about his recent flight into space.

title: Rugby player denied Australian citizenship despite representing the country 70 times
description: Rugby union player Quade Cooper says Australia has repeatedly denied him citizenship -- despite representing the country 70 times as a member of the national team.

title: Why Japan's fastest man trains with a set of wheels
description: If the Olympics were held on time last year, Ryota Yamagata wouldn't have qualified. One year later, he's been named captain of the country's delegation at the games in Tokyo. CNN's Blake Essig sits down with the Olympian to talk about how he took advantage of the pandemic to earn the opportunity to represent Japan at Tokyo 2020.

title: Almost half of this city may have had Covid-19
description: • Analysis: The political map is becoming the pandemic map

title: CNN anchor spars with official over controversial LGBTQ law
description: Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó defends the country's new law that bans information which "promotes" homosexuality and gender change being used in schools. The government claims it is doing to so protect children, though critics believe that prohibiting access to such information stigmatizes LGBTQ people.
